name: Vegan Sushi
instructions: Rinse the sushi rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Combine rice and water in a pot and cook until tender. Let it cool slightly.
Mix rice vinegar, sugar, and salt in a small bowl until dissolved. Stir into the rice.
Place a nori sheet on a bamboo sushi mat and spread a thin layer of rice.
Top with avocado, cucumber, and carrot.
Roll tightly and slice into 6-8 pieces.
Serve with soy sauce.

name: Soya Chunks in Tomato Sauce
instructions: Soak the soya chunks in hot water for 10 minutes and drain.
Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onions and garlic until soft.
Add the pureed tomatoes, tomato paste, cumin, coriander, and paprika.
Cook for 5 minutes until the sauce thickens.
Add soya chunks and water, and simmer for 15 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper, and serve.

name: Cuscuz (Tapioca)
instructions: Boil water with salt and olive oil.
Gradually add tapioca pearls while stirring.
Cover and simmer for 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Once tapioca is translucent, remove from heat.
Let it rest for 5 minutes, then fluff with a fork.
Garnish with chopped parsley and serve.

name: Lentil Red Curry
instructions: Heat olive oil in a pan and sauté the onions, garlic, and ginger until softened.
Add curry powder and turmeric and cook for 1 minute.
Stir in the lentils, coconut milk, diced tomatoes, and vegetable broth.
Simmer for 25-30 minutes, until lentils are tender.
Season with salt and pepper and serve.

name: Naan-like Bread
instructions: Mix the flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt in a bowl.
Add warm water, yogurt, and olive oil. Knead the dough for 10 minutes.
Cover the dough and let it rise for 1-2 hours.
Preheat a skillet over medium-high heat.
Roll out the dough and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side.
Brush with melted butter before serving.

name: Mushroom Creamy Soup
ingredients: 1 cup heavy cream or plant-based alternative
instructions: Sauté the onions and garlic in olive oil until soft.
Add the mushrooms and thyme and cook until mushrooms release their liquid.
Pour in the vegetable broth and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the cream and season with salt and pepper.
Blend until smooth, then serve.

name: Blue Cheese Pear Risotto
instructions: Heat olive oil in a pan and sauté the onion and garlic.
Add the rice and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes.
Add the wine and let it absorb.
Gradually add broth, stirring constantly, until the rice is tender.
Stir in the pear, blue cheese, and parmesan, and serve.

name: Banana Muffins
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F) and line a muffin tray with paper liners.
Mash the bananas and mix with the milk, oil, and sugar.
Add the dry ingredients and mix until combined.
Spoon the batter into the muffin tray and bake for 18-20 minutes.

name: Avocado Toast with Eggs and Mushrooms
instructions: Toast the bread and spread with mashed avocado.
Sauté the mushrooms in olive oil until golden.
Fry the eggs to your preference and place on the avocado toast.
Top with mushrooms, season with salt and pepper, and serve.

name: Chia Pudding with Passionfruit
instructions: Mix chia seeds, coconut milk, and maple syrup in a bowl.
Refrigerate overnight to thicken.
Top with passionfruit before serving.

name: Pasta Salad
instructions: Cook the pasta and let it cool.
Mix with tomatoes, avocado, eggs, olive oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper.
Serve chilled.

name: Coconut Rice and Crispy Tofu
instructions: Cook the rice with coconut milk according to package instructions.
Pan-fry the tofu in olive oil until crispy, seasoning with soy sauce, salt, and pepper.
Serve the rice topped with tofu.

name: Vegetable Barbecue Skewers
ingredients: 1 red bell pepper, cut into chunks
instructions: Thread vegetables onto skewers.
Brush with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Grill for 10-15 minutes, turning occasionally.

name: Fudgy Brownies
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F) and grease a baking pan.
Mix all ingredients in a bowl until smooth.
Bake for 25-30 minutes and let cool before slicing.

name: Goat Cheese and Honey Pizza
instructions: Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F).
Roll out pizza dough and top with goat cheese and honey.
Bake for 15-20 minutes until the crust is golden.
Top with arugula and drizzle with olive oil before serving.

name: Yellow Chickpea Curry
instructions: Sauté onions and garlic in oil until soft.
Add curry powder, turmeric, and chickpeas.
Stir in coconut milk and vegetable broth and simmer for 20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper and serve.

name: White Cake with Strawberry
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F) and grease a cake pan.
Mix dry ingredients and add wet ingredients.
Fold in strawberries and bake for 25-30 minutes.
Let cool before serving.

name: Risoni Pasta in Creamy Tomato Sauce
instructions: Cook risoni pasta according to package instructions.
Sauté onion and garlic in olive oil until softened.
Stir in tomatoes and cream, simmer for 5 minutes.
Toss pasta in sauce, season with salt and pepper, and serve.

name: Wild Rice and Tomato Risotto
instructions: Cook wild rice according to package instructions.
Sauté onions and garlic in olive oil until softened.
Stir in tomatoes, broth, and white wine.
Add rice and cook, stirring occasionally, until the sauce thickens.

name: Fake Meat Ragu & Polenta
ingredients: Salt and black pepper, to taste
1/4 cup grated parmesan or nutritional yeast
instructions: Heat 1 tbsp of olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
Add the onion, garlic, carrot, and celery, and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the plant-based ground meat and cook until browned, breaking it apart with a spoon.
Stir in the tomato paste, crushed tomatoes, vegetable broth, oregano, basil, red pepper flakes, salt, and black pepper.
Simmer for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce thickens.
While the sauce is cooking, prepare the polenta: bring 2 cups of water or vegetable broth to a boil.
Slowly whisk in the polenta, stirring constantly to prevent lumps.
Reduce heat to low and cook, stirring frequently, for about 10 minutes until thick and creamy.
Stir in the butter and grated parmesan or nutritional yeast, then remove from heat.
Serve the polenta in bowls, topped with the fake meat ragu.
Garnish with fresh basil or extra parmesan, if desired.
